intro: Metrosideros hispida, commonly known as the rough shieldvine, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has hairy, rough-textured leaves and is often found growing in coastal or rocky habitats. It is a shrub or small tree that can reach heights of up to 5 meters. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
